TopicTitle: How can I remove xp from my Kerbals?

Articles.Content: Okay so I was building a base on Duna by sending multiple modules to arrive at the LZ and assemble by docking them with rover wheels. Problem was that all my docking ports were attached the wrong way. So instead of letting that simple mistake ruin hours of work, I used hyperedit to teleport Bill there and correct the docking ports with KAS. It worked, but the problem is now I have a Kerbal with cheated XP. How can I remove it.
in the career log section of the persistance.sfs you will want to either remove the related duna line or the whole flight.
For a little more detail on steuben's comment, see this thread and do the opposite:

The only official ingame way is having them die.

Otherwise, like the others said, modifying the persistent files is your only other option.

54 minutes ago, storm_soldier2377 said:

Okay so I was building a base on Duna by sending multiple modules to arrive at the LZ and assemble by docking them with rover wheels. Problem was that all my docking ports were attached the wrong way. So instead of letting that simple mistake ruin hours of work, I used hyperedit to teleport Bill there and correct the docking ports with KAS. It worked, but the problem is now I have a Kerbal with cheated XP. How can I remove it.

Next time instead of bringing an engineer to the problem bring the problem to the engineer. Edit the ship back to KSC, fix the problem and edit the ship back to Duna. Same amount of 'cheating', same results and no unforeseen side effects.

Thanks, I got it fixed.

12 minutes ago, Tex_NL said:

Next time instead of bringing an engineer to the problem bring the problem to the engineer. Edit the ship back to KSC, fix the problem and edit the ship back to Duna. Same amount of 'cheating', same results and no unforeseen side effects.

By the time I noticed the issue the craft files were long gone.
How can you remove XP from.... hmmm... tell them to update to windows 7 or else.
